@graph.headline: Shopify Handles Your Sales Tax, Right? WRONG.
@graph.description: Shopify collects sales tax from customers at checkout based on your store's tax settings. However, merchants are responsible for filing returns and remitting these collected funds to state and local governments.

@graph.name: Shopify Handles Your Sales Tax, Right? WRONG.

itemListElement.name: Does Shopify Collect and Remit Sales Tax

hasDefinedTerm.name: Nexus
hasDefinedTerm.description: A connection to a state that means you have to collect tax there. Can be physical presence or economic activity.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Remittance
hasDefinedTerm.description: The act of sending collected tax money to the state government.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Seller of Record
hasDefinedTerm.description: The legal entity responsible for tax collection and remittance - typically the merchant, not the platform.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Economic Nexus
hasDefinedTerm.description: Tax obligation triggered by sales volume or transaction count in a state, typically $100,000 in sales OR 200 transactions per year.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Marketplace Facilitator
hasDefinedTerm.description: A platform that processes payments and is legally required to collect and remit sales tax on behalf of sellers.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Sales Tax
hasDefinedTerm.description: A consumption tax paid by customers but collected and remitted by merchants to state and local governments.

@graph.name: How to Set Up Sales Tax Collection in Shopify
@graph.description: Step-by-step process to configure sales tax collection in your Shopify store

supply.name: Sales tax permits from relevant states

step.name: Determine Your Nexus
step.text: Figure out which states you have nexus in before doing anything else. Don't proceed without this critical step.

step.name: Get Sales Tax Permits
step.text: You CANNOT collect tax without being registered. Go to each state's Department of Revenue website and apply for a sales tax permit. They'll give you an ID number.

step.name: Configure Shopify Settings
step.text: Go into your Shopify settings. Navigate to Settings > Taxes and duties. Find the United States section.

step.name: Enter Tax ID Numbers
step.text: For every state where you got a permit, click in and enter that Sales tax ID number they gave you. Once you do that, Shopify starts calculating tax automatically for that state.

mainEntity.name: How is Shopify different from Amazon on sales tax?

acceptedAnswer.text: Amazon is a marketplace, they remit the tax for you. Shopify is a platform for your own store, so it just collects the money and you have to remit it yourself. The responsibility is totally different.

mainEntity.name: What information does Shopify use to calculate tax?

acceptedAnswer.text: The customer's shipping address. That's pretty much it. If it's wrong, the tax will be wrong.

mainEntity.name: What do I do after Shopify collects the tax?

acceptedAnswer.text: You file and you remit. That's your whole job. You use the data from Shopify's reports to fill out the state's forms and send them the money you collected. On time. Every time.

itemListElement.name: Register with every single state you owe tax to
File their tax returns on time
